data.title: Eastern Railroad
data.meta_description: Eastern Railroad - subject overview. A railroad company that connected Boston and Portland, Maine. In 1840 the Eastern Railroad of New Hampshire was leased to the Eastern Railroad of...
data.text:
Description

A railroad company that connected Boston and Portland, Maine. In 1840 the Eastern Railroad of New Hampshire was leased to the Eastern Railroad of Massachusetts. By 1843, the Eastern entered into an agreement with the Boston & Maine to share the Portland, Saco and Portsmouth Railroad's tracks in Maine, which allowed both railroads to begin providing Boston-to-Portland service. On April 28, 1847, the Eastern and the Boston & Maine co-leased the Portland, Saco & Portsmouth.

See also: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_Railroad

Related Subjects

The graph displays the other subjects mentioned on the same pages as the subject "Eastern Railroad". If the same subject occurs on a page with "Eastern Railroad" more than once, it appears closer to "Eastern Railroad" on the graph, and is colored in a darker shade. The closer a subject is to the center, the more "related" the subjects are.
